result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cameron E Hopson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cameron E Hopson in court, in custody.  
Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court for Cameron E Hopson.  
Attorney Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Plea Hearing.
Defense advises the court he will be seeking to resolve this case in Mental Health Court.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Received and Filed: Letter from Defendant's Mother.

Defendant Cameron E Hopson in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Cameron E Hopson in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court on defense motion to modify bail. Arguments heard by defense and the State. Court DENIED defense bail motion for reasons placed on the record
Case remains calendared in Branch 19 for a Plea Hearing on 10-13-2022 at 3:00pm.
Received and Filed by Attorney Hampton. Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail.

HELD OFF RECORD WITH APPROVAL OF JUDGE KIES. 

Off record discussions held. Due to Court congestion and availability case is adjourned.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse. Parties notified.

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court, defendant Cameron E Hopson not in court, in custody.  
William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court for bail hearing.  Statements made.  Court GRANTS the request and set bail at $4,000 non-monetary conditions apply.  Case is adjourned for plea.

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court, defendant Cameron E Hopson not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hampton appeared by video means. Defense is requesting a bail review and a plea hearing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 45.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Cameron E Hopson in court with Attorney Robert J Hampton; both appear by video.  Defendant Cameron E Hopson in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer Z. Wilber.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss.  (Cameron E. Hopson - #2022004496, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JJH.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

02:17 PM Defendant Cameron E Hopson in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Cameron E Hopson in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cameron E Hopson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
